titleStmt.title: A conference of the Catholike and Protestante doctrine with the expresse words of Holie Scripture. Which is the second parte of the prudentiall balance of religion. : VVherein is clearely shewed, that in more than 260 points of controuersie, Catholicks agree with the Holie Scripture, both in words and sense: and Protestants disagree in both, and depraue both the sayings, words, and sense of Scripture. / Written first in Latin, but now augmented and translated into English.
Collatio doctrinae Catholicorum ac Protestantium cum expressis S. Scripturae verbis. English. 1631
titleStmt.author: Smith, Richard, 1566-1655.

titleStmt.title: A conference of the Catholike and Protestante doctrine with the expresse words of Holie Scripture. Which is the second parte of the prudentiall balance of religion. : VVherein is clearely shewed, that in more than 260 points of controuersie, Catholicks agree with the Holie Scripture, both in words and sense: and Protestants disagree in both, and depraue both the sayings, words, and sense of Scripture. / Written first in Latin, but now augmented and translated into English.
Collatio doctrinae Catholicorum ac Protestantium cum expressis S. Scripturae verbis. English. 1631
titleStmt.author: Smith, Richard, 1566-1655.

publicationStmt.publisher: By the widdowe of Marke Wyon, at the signe of the Phenix.,

notesStmt.note: Contents of chapters, and scripture references, p. [1]-[9] at end.
"Faults escaped in the printing"--P. [10] at end.
Reproduction of original in: Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
